programme.desc: Welcome to Episode 25 of the Mitchell Pehlke Lacrosse Show presented by Duke Cannon! Jack Rowlett joins the show! You can't kill the Chaos. Doogs updates his who should the MVP should've been. Lastly, a start bench cut of Gatorade flavors.

programme.desc: Paul Carcaterra visits Princeton, N.J. to get to know the fourth-overall pick in the 2025 PLL Draft: Coulter Mackesy. Doogs updates his who should the MVP should've been. Lastly, a start bench cut of Gatorade flavors.

programme.desc: In a showcase of incredible bare-knuckle matchmaking,LEONARDO PERDOMO vs LEO BERCIER,GEE PEREZ vs ALBERT INCLAN,CHRISTINE VICENS vs MELANIE SHAH &JUSTIN IBARROLA vs RICK CARUSO demonstrate the grittiness of BKFC.

programme.desc: From the Agora Theater in Cleveland, Ohio, hometown comedy legend Bill Squire's comedy special continues to discover the threads connecting his own childhood to his role as a parent.

programme.desc: Tamar Rubin stakes her claim as a fresh comedic voice in her debut special, "But Sir!"; she combines a gritty punk sensibility with the polish of a trained actor.

programme.title: Ginny Hogan: Regression
programme.desc: Ginny Hogan has an idea of what her life should look like by 30, and she's got a plan to get herself there.

programme.title: Andrew Orvedahl: Doom Math
programme.desc: The debut special from Andrew Orvedahl filmed in front of a sold out crowd in his hometown of Denver, Colo.

programme.title: Felicia Madison: Better Than Sex
programme.desc: In Felicia's first comedy special she covers it all - childhood, marriage, kids and even depression.

programme.title: John Beuhler: Inappropriate
programme.desc: Political correctness be damned! John Beuhler dances on the edge of good taste, delivering sharp, fearless comedy in his bold debut special.

programme.title: Gregg Rogell: Balloon Animals
programme.desc: Gregg Rogell, the master of the slow burn, twists and stretches modern life in a comedic journey.

programme.title: Jim Gaffigan: Quality Time
programme.desc: The comedian discusses why we aren’t honest about not wanting to attend events, lying to children, and so much more in this hilarious special.

programme.title: Jim Gaffigan: Noble Ape
programme.desc: The stand-up comedy star describes how his wife faced a medical crisis, and he attempted to hold down the fort for their five children.

programme.title: Tom Segura: Completely Normal
programme.desc: Radio, television and live performance veteran Tom Segura shares a few off-hand appraisals on hotels and hobbies with a cool and thoughtful demeanor.

programme.title: Last ExMas
programme.desc: Ex-girlfriends Maggie and Julianne find themselves unexpectedly rekindling their spark during a hometown visit over the holidays.

programme.title: Love Dump
programme.desc: A quirky, thrift shop owner meets a dog lawyer and they fall madly in love, however, her quest to find her missing father puts their relationship in jeopardy.

programme.title: Dino Vigo: All In
programme.desc: A skilled writer, as well as performer-Vigo seems poised to take the comedy world by storm and yet remains remarkably grounded in his approach to his craft.

programme.title: Theodore M.E. Taylor's The Bowtie Guy
programme.desc: Follow comedian Theodore M.E. Taylor as he discusses cultural and political differences, the pressures of poverty and passing in affluent company, and code switching and shaping identity around social prejudices in his breakout comedy special.

programme.title: Damon Millard: Nothing to Nobody
programme.desc: Seven years after his debut, Damon Millard returns with a comedy special.

programme.title: Nick Alexander Presents Nick Alexander
programme.desc: Nick Alexander marks his debut special, as he performs a coming-of-age set highlighting boyhood, his Haitian upbringing, relationships, depression, the pandemic, and everything in between while celebrating his birthday.

programme.title: Tony Rock: Rock The World
programme.desc: Description Unavailable

programme.title: Earthquake: (Practice) the Secret Files of Earthquake
programme.desc: Earthquake brings his hilarious and straightforward signature comedic style to his all-new stand-up special that you won’t want to miss.

programme.title: Zarna Garg: One in a Billion
programme.desc: Zarna, an Indian-Immigrant mom, has plenty to joke about.

programme.title: Maria Bamford: Local Act
programme.desc: Beloved comedian and best-selling author Maria Bamford reveals the joy and sense of community of being an LA comic in this intimate stand-up special.

programme.title: Kylie Brakeman: Linda Hollywood's Big Night
programme.desc: Character comedian Kylie Brakeman teaches an acting masterclass as Linda Hollywood, a problematic, old school talent agent on a mission to spread her industry wisdom-and save her own career in the process.

programme.title: Lina Green: Daddy Issues, Death, & Dildos
programme.desc: Comic Lina Green performs on stage, sharing some observations from her life.

programme.title: Nicole Burch: Mama Drama
programme.desc: Nicole Burch opens up about getting pregnant from a one-night stand with her friend Craig and how she’s managing to co-parent a toddler with him.

programme.title: Ryan Erwin: Full Time Quitter
programme.desc: Ryan Erwin looks at his inability in keeping a regular job; Erwin hilariously informs a sold-out Utah crowd why the job they're watching him do is the only one he's able to keep.

programme.title: Dino Archie: The Lord's Work
programme.desc: From start to finish, Dino puts his foot on the gas and keeps going with non stop laughs.

programme.title: Damon Sumner: I'm a Professional
programme.desc: In his debut special, Damon Sumner hilariously dives into his inability to maintain a social life, raising both his kids and those of others and maintaining friendships as a couple at The Limelight Theater in Atlanta, Ga.

programme.desc: Dan achieves a major financial milestone, reconsidering his belief in the ‘Conners curse.’

programme.title: The Conners
programme.desc: Mark takes on odd jobs, determined to find a way to pay for school.

programme.title: The Conners
programme.desc: A sudden turn of events forces the Conners to face their daily struggles in a way they never have before.

programme.title: The Conners
programme.desc: Darlene is in for one surprise after another when David introduces his girlfriend, Blue (Juliette Lewis), and mentions that Mark and Harris will be spending the weekend with them.

programme.title: The Conners
programme.desc: It's Halloween, the favorite time of year for the Conners, but an email from the school banning certain costumes, including Mark's, sets off an argument between Dan and Darlene.

programme.title: The Conners
programme.desc: Geena learns D.J. hasn't been taking Mary to church while she's been away, so she insists they go as a family.

programme.title: The Conners
programme.desc: A family member drops a life-changing announcement; Dan suspects that Becky isn't sticking to her end of the deal about her drinking; Darlene continues her job search.

programme.title: The Conners
programme.desc: With Mark and Mary's help, Jackie convinces Dan to build a chicken coop so the family can eat organic eggs.

programme.title: The Conners

programme.title: Mystery Science Theater 3000
programme.desc: Joel and the Bots learn the ins and outs of the circus in the short Here Comes the Circus (1946) and then try to make sense of the Nordic fairy tale film The Day the Earth Froze (1959).

programme.title: Mystery Science Theater 3000
programme.desc: Mike and the Bots watch 1961s "Bloodlust"; Dr. Forrester's deranged mother comes for a visit.

programme.title: Mystery Science Theater 3000
programme.desc: "The Undead" (1957) Cult. A therapist and a prostitute visit the Dark Ages; directed by Roger Corman.

programme.title: Mystery Science Theater 3000
programme.desc: "Blood Waters of Dr. Z" (1972) Horror. A Florida scientist turns into a walking catfish. With Marshall Grauer and Wade Popwell.

programme.title: Mystery Science Theater 3000
programme.desc: "The Giant Spider Invasion" (1975) Cult. Scientist and girlfriend spy car-size mutant spiders; with Steve Brodie, Barbara Hale.

programme.title: Mystery Science Theater 3000
programme.desc: "Time of the Apes" (1987) Science fiction. Two children and a frozen woman wake up 2,000 years later, when apes and a computer rule the world. With Reiko Tokunaga, Hiroko Saito, Masaaki Kaji.

programme.title: Mystery Science Theater 3000
programme.desc: "The Corpse Vanishes" (1942) Horror. A mad botanist drains kidnapped brides to keep his 80-year-old wife looking young. With Bela Lugosi, Luana Walters, Elizabeth Russell.

programme.title: Mystery Science Theater 3000
programme.desc: "Robot Monster" (1953) Science fiction. Earthlings flee from the Ro-Man, a martian in a gorilla suit with a diving helmet. Originally 3-D. With George Nader, Claudia Barrett, Selena Royle.

programme.title: Mystery Science Theater 3000
programme.desc: "First Spaceship on Venus" (1960) Science fiction. International astronauts go to Venus and find what's left of a race that destroyed itself. With Yoko Tani, Oldrich Lukes, Ignacy Machowski.

programme.title: Mystery Science Theater 3000
programme.desc: Three coffee shop customers help an owner rob an armored car.

programme.title: Mystery Science Theater 3000
programme.desc: A bizarre ocean creature spreads panic throughout Florida after a botched scientific experiment in "Devilfish.".

programme.title: Mystery Science Theater 3000
programme.desc: "Escape 2000" (1985) science fiction. Newswoman and Bronx warrior vs. borough exterminator; with Mark Gregory, Henry Silva, Valeria D'Obici.

programme.title: Mystery Science Theater 3000
programme.desc: "Future War" (1996) Fantasy. An alien prisoner escapes from his cyborg captors and flees to Earth. With Mel Novak.

programme.title: Mystery Science Theater 3000
programme.desc: Mike and the bots learn the art of safe driving in the 1959 short, Last Clear Chance. Later, they watch government agents use radar technology to catch criminals in Radar Secret Service (1950).

programme.title: Mystery Science Theater 3000
programme.desc: Secret Agent Bart Fargo chases the kidnappers of the inventor of a death ray. Tom makes his own death ray for peaceful use but caves in to the pressure to use it on Crow.

programme.title: Mystery Science Theater 3000
programme.desc: "The Mad Monster" (1942) Horror. A reporter's girlfriend's father injects a farmhand with wolf blood. With Johnny Downs, George Zucco, Anne Nagel.

programme.title: Mystery Science Theater 3000
programme.desc: Jonah's crew watches an evil woman bent on dominating the world with her all-woman army.

programme.title: Mystery Science Theater 3000
programme.desc: "Teenage Caveman" (1958) Drama. Primitives discover they are survivors of a nuclear blast years earlier; with Robert Vaughn, Darrah Marshall, Leslie Bradley.

programme.title: Mystery Science Theater 3000
programme.desc: In Indestructible Man, a violent criminal named Butcher Benson is executed and becomes indestructible when he’s brought back to life . Butcher seeks revenge against those who caused his execution.

programme.title: 1 vs. 100
programme.desc: Professional dancer Carrie Ann Inaba hosts this show in which a contestant can win $50,000. The contestant, known as the One, competes with a mob of 100 other players by answering questions. When the One answers correctly, each member of the mob that answered incorrectly is eliminated. The One earns money for each mob member who is eliminated. If the One can eliminate the entire mob, he wins $50,000. But if the One gets a question wrong, he is eliminated and the remaining mob members split his winnings.

programme.title: Total Wipeout
programme.desc: 10 celebrities will be taking the reindeer-drawn celebrity sleigh to the top of the Qualifier.

programme.title: Total Wipeout
programme.desc: The Winter Blob makes a welcome appearance to send the contestants into orbit whilst Granny’s House.

programme.title: Wipeout Canada
programme.desc: Slippery Stairs, Block Swing, The Crusher, Log Roll, and Barrel Crossing are some of the over-the-top obstacles in this week’s episode.

programme.title: Wipeout Australia
programme.desc: Mesmerized by Bon Bon’s Belly Dancing, we catch up with our favourite Big Balls in the Qualifier. They dish out punishment to Australia’s very own female Jim Carrey and send Big Cat tamer Robbie into the pond. Goofy Goggles up the ante on the Dreadmill causing the Breakdancing Dad to create hilarious new moves. Golden Guns, Marisa battles it out for the ladies against Perfect Specimen, Seamus in the Wipeout Zone.

programme.title: Wipeout Australia
programme.desc: It’s Sitcom Central on Wipeout Australia with the Odd Couple, starring World’s Strongest Dwarf, David Clarke and Gentle Giant, Tim Watts. Once again the Big Balls deliver some spectacular moments with an Italian Chef being sliced and diced. Sacks are introduced at the Sweeper proving too much for some, but surprisingly helping the ladies to even things out as we go into a 50/50 male, female split in the Wipeout Zone.

programme.title: Total Wipeout
programme.desc: This time the 'Dodgeball Men' are back to make 'The Qualifier' game an even bigger challenge for contestants.

programme.title: Total Wipeout
programme.desc: Today’s courageous band of volunteers include a former world class athlete intent on making a comeback.

programme.title: Total Wipeout
programme.desc: This week they have added a new obstacle called 'The Dreadmill'.

programme.title: Total Wipeout

programme.title: Total Wipeout
programme.desc: It's another high-octane, low-pain-threshold edition of crazed knockabout game show Total Wipeout.

programme.title: Total Wipeout

programme.title: Wipeout Canada
programme.desc: Wipeout Canada brings you a countdown of the season's most memorable moments with never-before-seen footage, extended scenes and live interviews with some of the most popular contestants.

programme.title: Wipeout Canada
programme.desc: Topple towers, Cookie Cutter, The Tails, Teeter Totters and Crazy Beams are among the over-the-top obstacles on this week’s episode.

programme.title: Total Wipeout
programme.desc: In this episode, the North of the country takes on the South in a battle to win the coveted trophy.

programme.title: Wipeout Australia
programme.desc: It’s no doubt that the ‘Ball Crusher’ Sweeper is the star of tonight’s show. With a brother- sister team hanging by a thread and a three-way hurdle, this week’s Sweeper writes itself into the History books. Tonight is also the night we meet Buffman, a pint sized Superhero with a twitch and a photo finish at the Dizzy Dummy threatens extinction to a Rare Breed. A week of action packed Wipeouts with Latin Dancing lotharios, what more can you ask for? And for the kids, a Fairy Tale, Wipeout Style!

programme.title: The Almost Impossible Gameshow
programme.desc: Another episode of the game show in which 50 members of the public compete - with almost no chance of winning.

programme.title: Wipeout Canada

programme.desc: You will see 10 celebrities get wet and repeatedly face tough obstacles in order to win the grand final.

programme.title: Wipeout Canada

programme.title: Wipeout Australia
programme.desc: Fashion comes to Wipeout Australia as we meet Adam “God’s Gift” Marshall, a self styled Ad man who conquers the Qualifier. Other Catwalk moments include the Grandpa in his Red Speedos and a Rainbow Bright Personal Ad. If jumping a revolving arm while balancing on a pedestal above water isn’t enough for you then you’ll love this weeks Sweeper. Contestants are armed with Dodgeballs, to be deployed at each other, creating horrific hits and spectacular spills. The Dizzy Dummy claims its first victim as Dummy Tummy rejects a contestant and the Wipeout Zone becomes a battle of young and old.

programme.desc: Tonight, twenty brave battlers will take on the wintry weirdness.

programme.title: MasterChef
programme.desc: The judges challenge the remaining seven amateur cooks to use their imagination in the next mystery box challenge, which features shrimp. The hopefuls will have a very limited pantry and little time to create a standout dish that will impress the judges. The winner of the mystery box challenge will determine which savory ingredient the remaining hopefuls must incorporate into a dessert dish in the elimination round. Find out whose savory treat will please the judges and who will be on the chopping block.

programme.title: MasterChef
programme.desc: The remaining six home cooks compete in a high-pressure team challenge at Hatfield's, one of the most talked about restaurants in Hollywood. The contestants will split into two teams and replicate the award-winning restaurant's signature dishes. The team that executes a fine dining experience which impresses the judges, restaurant owners and hungry diners will win the challenge, while the losing team will be sent into the dreaded pressure test. Later, the contestants facing elimination will have to prepare steak three different ways. Find out whose dishes will prove to be a job well done and who will be cut from the competition.

programme.title: Big Dreams, Small Spaces
programme.desc: In Brighton determined duo Helen and Dax have their hands full with twins, one of whom has special needs. Meanwhile in High Wycombe, newly single Valerie is looking for a fresh lease of life.

programme.title: Big Dreams, Small Spaces
programme.desc: Monty Don visits two sets of ambitious gardeners, each facing challenges on a very different scale. One is a tiny urban courtyard in Hackney and the other is a outdoor area for a community.

programme.title: Big Dreams, Small Spaces
programme.desc: Monty meets two sets of gardeners who have unimaginable ambitions for their outdoor spaces. In Essex Denise has never ventured beyond the decking area behind her house. Meanwhile in Ipswich, a father and daughter plan to build a terraced allotment.

programme.title: Big Dreams, Small Spaces
programme.desc: Monty comes to the rescue of two couples in need of help transforming their rubble filled back gardens into havens of peace and tranquillity. They are in serious need of help and advice but can Monty set them on the right track?

programme.title: Monty Don's Italian Gardens
programme.desc: Monty Don conducts a personal grand tour around Italy's magnificent gardens from the luxurious retreats of the moneyed north to the lavish hideaways of the romantic south. In this episode, he's in and around Rome, a powerbase of emperors and popes, to explore gardens that are among some of the most extravagant and flamboyant ever created in history.

programme.title: Monty Don's Italian Gardens
programme.desc: Monty Don is on a grand tour around Italy, this time visiting gardens both in Florence and around the sun-scorched Tuscan countryside. Monty discovers how, like a piece of sculpture, renaissance gardens were created as works of art, and how a group of Edwardian ex-pats mistakenly reinforced the idea that formal Italian gardens were flowerless.

programme.title: Monty Don's Italian Gardens
programme.desc: Monty Don continues his grand garden tour of Italy. This time he is in Naples to visit some of the most sublime, romantic retreats in southern Italy. After all the formality of the green gardens around Rome and Florence, Monty seeks out idyllic horticultural gems set against the dramatic scenery of the Amalfi Coast to discover why, in the south, gardens are informal and, above all, filled with flowers.

programme.title: Monty Don's Italian Gardens
programme.desc: Monty Don concludes his garden tour of Italy in the wealthy north where, in the Veneto and Lucca, extravagant pleasure gardens were created for flirtation and fun. In the Lakes, Monty meets up with the garden society, the Grandi Giardini Italiani, to peer over the fence at luxurious creations of the rich and famous. The journey ends on Lake Maggiore to see the most theatrical horticultural gem of Italy.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: Monty turns his attention to his ornamental grass borders, Carol travels to Cheshire to view some heleniums, and Joe is treated to a Jamaican feast when he visits Moor Green Allotments in Birmingham.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: Adam Frost gives tips on lawn repair, grows some unusual vegetables and plants a seasonal container. Advolly Richmond brings us up to date in her history of lawns by exploring the trend for ever more sophisticated machinery.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: Now that the rambling roses have finished flowering, Monty turns his attention to pruning and tying in new growth for a good display next year. On the 20th anniversary of the death of Geoff Hamilton, Adam Frost returns to the famous `Gardeners' World' location, Barnsdale, to pay tribute and to revisit some his own early gardening memories. Also, we travel to Abergavenny to visit the garden of a sweet pea enthusiast to get her top tips for growing the best blooms.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: Joe Swift pays a visit to the Northumberland garden of Chris Mullin who, after over twenty years as a Member of Parliament, has turned his attention to the renovation of his walled garden. And National Trust head gardener, Alan Power, catches up with the transformation of Shakespeare's New Place garden in Stratford-upon-Avon.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: Now that birds are no longer nesting in hedges, now is the time to get them looking trim and neat and Monty has plenty of tips on how to cut them so that they grow well. Alan Power visits Croome Park in Worcestershire to discover more about one of the first great landscapes of Capability Brown and we visit a couple in Gloucestershire whose ornamental grass garden was inspired by the Far East.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: With the bank holiday ahead there's plenty of opportunity to catch up with some essential jobs in the garden and Monty gives a masterclass on how to look after and prune soft fruit to ensure maximum production next year. Frances Tophill is at RHS Rosemoor where she is catching up on her vegetable trials which she started earlier in the year, and Alan Power visits Hestercombe Gardens in Somerset to find out more about the discovery of a long lost gladiolus.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: Monty and the regular team are joined by some new faces offering tips, advice and inspiration from gardens large and small across the country. In this programme Monty is at Longmeadow catching up with some seasonal jobs, and also getting out and about for an inspiring visit to the longest herbaceous border in the world.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: Monty is at Longmeadow giving advice on how to deal with unruly roses, taking cuttings of herbs and planting a new tree. Carol Klein continues her series on plant families, exploring some of the most popular relations of the rose and we pay a visit to an orchard in Worcestershire to find out how enthusiasts are caring for one of the rose family members - the plum.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: September is the perfect time for planting and Monty adds some autumn flowering asters to his borders as well as refreshing his strawberry beds with new stock. Carol Klein continues her series on plant families and this week she takes a close look at one of the largest plant families in the world, the daisy family, and we pay a visit to a plant nursery in Hampshire, which specialises in growing plants - including many varieties of daisy - for attracting wildlife.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: There's plenty of advice from Longmeadow this week, as Monty starts to tidy up the garden for autumn and reviews this year's display in the jewel garden. In the final part of Carol Klein's series on plant families she looks at the Apiaceae family, which includes not only stalwart and wild-life friendly plants but also edible roots; and we pay a visit to a giant vegetable grower in Nottinghamshire who is hoping to break the world record with his carrots.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: With the garden growing before our eyes, Monty Don has plenty to be getting on with at Longmeadow. In preparation for late summer grass borders, he's filling the gaps that the diseased box hedges have left with grasses he's raised from seed.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: As the plants in the jewel garden reach the peak of their late summer glory, Monty starts planning for the spring when he plants ferns and gives advice on the care and maintenance of wildlife ponds.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: Monty Don has left Longmeadow this week to explore the beautiful gardens at RHS Hyde Hall in Essex. He seeks inspiration from their amazing dry garden and discovers how they manage to keep their lawns looking pristine in such a hot summer.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: British summer time means that, from Saturday, we all have an extra hour to get out in our gardens in the evenings just as the early spring display is coming into its own. At Longmeadow, Monty Don introduces us to the coppice, a woodland area where his favourite flower, the primrose, is in bloom. As well as enjoying the seasonal colours of spring, it's time to plan the summer display. Monty sows sweet peas.

programme.title: Monty Don's Adriatic Gardens
programme.desc: Monty travels to Europe and explores the influence of the Venetians on gardening. To begin with, he explores Venice on one of the city's famous barges, stepping out to visit green spaces large and small that are often hidden from view behind high walls.

programme.title: Monty Don's Adriatic Gardens
programme.desc: Monty begins in the city of Trieste, close to Italy's border with Croatia, to visit a public garden first created by an obsessive royal plantsman more than 150 years ago, which is now being carefully restored. He then heads down the Adriatic coast through Croatia to pick up the trail that the Venetians followed, ending his journey on the beautiful island of Lopud, near Dubrovnik.

programme.title: Monty Don's Adriatic Gardens
programme.desc: Monty begins the last leg of his journey in Corfu, a Greek island with strong Venetian links, including olive trees planted by them that are still grown today. Here, Monty visits a spectacular garden made by an Englishman with Greek connections.

programme.title: Monty Don's Italian Gardens
programme.desc: Monty Don conducts a personal grand tour around Italy's magnificent gardens from the luxurious retreats of the moneyed north to the lavish hideaways of the romantic south. In this episode, he's in and around Rome, a powerbase of emperors and popes, to explore gardens that are among some of the most extravagant and flamboyant ever created in history.

programme.title: Monty Don's Italian Gardens
programme.desc: Monty Don is on a grand tour around Italy, this time visiting gardens both in Florence and around the sun-scorched Tuscan countryside. Monty discovers how, like a piece of sculpture, renaissance gardens were created as works of art, and how a group of Edwardian ex-pats mistakenly reinforced the idea that formal Italian gardens were flowerless.

programme.title: Monty Don's Italian Gardens
programme.desc: Monty Don continues his grand garden tour of Italy. This time he is in Naples to visit some of the most sublime, romantic retreats in southern Italy. After all the formality of the green gardens around Rome and Florence, Monty seeks out idyllic horticultural gems set against the dramatic scenery of the Amalfi Coast to discover why, in the south, gardens are informal and, above all, filled with flowers.

programme.title: Monty Don's Italian Gardens
programme.desc: Monty Don concludes his garden tour of Italy in the wealthy north where, in the Veneto and Lucca, extravagant pleasure gardens were created for flirtation and fun. In the Lakes, Monty meets up with the garden society, the Grandi Giardini Italiani, to peer over the fence at luxurious creations of the rich and famous. The journey ends on Lake Maggiore to see the most theatrical horticultural gem of Italy.

programme.title: The Secret History of the British Garden
programme.desc: Starting his journey at the sole surviving garden of the 1600s, Levens Hall in Cumbria, Monty sets out to investigate what the gardens of this age would have looked like and what influenced and inspired their creation.

programme.title: The Secret History of the British Garden
programme.desc: Monty bases himself at Rousham House in Oxfordshire, designed by one of the first practitioners of the landscape movement, William Kent. It has survived almost unchanged since its completion in 1741.

programme.title: The Secret History of the British Garden
programme.desc: Monty Don explores the extraordinary transformations that occurred throughout the 19th century. As a result of an expanding empire, scientific and technological innovation and social change, British gardens became more exotic, more colourful and more widely accessible than ever before.

programme.title: The Secret History of the British Garden
programme.desc: Monty Don concludes his journey through Britain's gardening heritage by looking at how the nation's gardens have evolved over the last hundred years. He looks at the profound effect that two world wars had on the attitude to gardens and gardening.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: Monty plans for next year's fruit harvest when he adds gooseberries to the fruit garden he planted earlier in the year. He also divides and moves herbaceous perennials and advises on the best bulbs to plant now for cut flowers next year. Frances Tophill meets a couple who have filled their garden with tender plants and devised a meticulous method of protecting them over the winter.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: Monty Don takes a look at the use of pots and containers and revels in their versatility, practicality and potential and shows us how best to use them in our own gardens. Carol Klein returns to Stroud to see how the new gardeners are progressing.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: Monty catches up with seasonal jobs at Longmeadow when he divides some perennials and plants alpines for spring colour. He also travels to Dublin to meet Helen Dillon to find out why she is planning to leave her world famous garden after decades of honing it to perfection. In Scotland, Joe Swift begins his quest to find out why we should rekindle our love for rock gardens.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: After months of nurturing the plants in his garden, Monty reaps a harvest of a different kind when he investigates how productive his bees have been at making honey. Joe Swift visits the world famous Chatsworth House in Derbyshire to explore the history of its monumental 19th-century rock garden and to see how a more contemporary version compliments the original design.

programme.desc: The guys meet up with Tyler Farr and Nate Hosie. Then, they call in a longbeard right off the roost. programme.title: Spring Thunder

programme.title: Spring Thunder

programme.title: Spring Thunder

programme.title: Beyond The Surface

programme.title: Winchester Life
programme.desc: Every spring brings a new opportunity to take a step forward & recall the memories of seasons past. World War II Veteran and retired Judge Arden Hill has spent most of his life chasing turkeys in the hills of Tennessee. Now in his 90’s, Arden doesn’t let age stand in the way of his love for spring turkey hunting. Also: patterning turkey shotguns and hunting spring gobblers.

programme.title: Winchester Life
programme.desc: Winchester introduces the Shoot United brand aimed at offering useful information and tips to the millions of new shooters entering the shooting sports. New York native and Midland University competitive shotgun shooter Amy Cawley and her journey as a student-athlete is followed. Also: Theo Ribbs gives shooting tips for competition and Foster Bartholow reviews Winchester AA Diamond Grade.

programme.title: Winchester Life
programme.desc: Charles Rodney’s relationship with his hunting dogs, passion for field-to-table living and connection to the land make his love for chasing rabbits contagious while the heritage of Winchester’s small game ammunition makes this beloved pastime accessible for generations to come. Also: a Model 42 collection for the ages and hunting Kansas coyotes with the Keefer Brothers.

programme.title: Winchester Life
programme.desc: Deer season — the sights, the sounds and the smells stick with you. It’s about remembering those who came before us and setting the right example for those who look up to us. It’s about protecting the tradition, so they always have something to look forward to. When communities come together, we see the real reason for this special time of year.
Brady Snyder hunts down a giant Iowa buck on public land.

programme.desc: Hunting wild hogs at night with thermal optics is a unique thrill. But even in prime pig country, catching up with night swine can be a serious challenge. Feral hogs are cagey and unpredictable—they read no scripts—and they'll definitely keep you on the edge of your seat as you wait for the perfect opportunity to make bacon.

programme.desc: With Meredith McCord halfway around the world, Capt. Justin Leake gives show producer Chris Hermans his first shot at landing a tarpon after filming them for 9 seasons. Does art imitate life?

programme.title: Chasin' The Sun

programme.title: Chasin' The Sun

programme.title: The Raven Project
programme.desc: It’s the opening week of rifle camp and everyone is ready to go. Big Hoss has a close encounter with a big eight point and Cody finds himself having a little Déjà vu when a big buck walks out into the same plot he killed in last year.

programme.title: The Raven Project
programme.desc: Randy and Cody are wrapping things up on the Raven before bow season arrives in Missouri. Planting I-70 the plot where Randy killed one of his biggest Missouri bucks ever last year. Then Randy and Cody attempt to setup a new farm they are calling “The River Farm” they attempt to plant a food plot, bush hog, spray the plot, setup a new Titan blind, and setup a Hooyman dual perimeter fence all in one day before the sun goes down.

programme.title: The Raven Project
programme.desc: While Randy and Dustin are trying to get the farm ready for Fall plots and create new access trails, Cody is at the river living life to the fullest. Randy finally has had enough and is doing something about Cody’s lack of effort on the farm.

programme.title: The Raven Project
programme.desc: Randy has been playing cat and mouse with a buck called “The Kansas 8” and after 2 encounters he is trying to seal the coffin on this big Missouri whitetail once and for all.

programme.title: The Raven Project
programme.desc: Back at the Raven for bow camp and everything is coming together. Randy has a close encounter with one of the OG bucks on the property while Nate closes the deal on a big five year old.

programme.title: The Raven Project
programme.desc: Randy and Cody are all hands-on deck at the Raven. Things are coming down to the wire with bow season just around the corner. With just over a week left they are trying to get everything wrapped up before the first bow camp.

programme.title: Goin' Coastal
programme.desc: Josh and Anna set out for a last minute fishing trip that runs a little late. They take a quick detour to the parent pick up line to get the kids from school, and head back out on the water to see what’s biting!

programme.title: Goin' Coastal
programme.desc: Josh and Alex explore the SS United States; the world‘s largest artificial reef.

programme.title: Saltwater Underground
programme.desc: Summer fluke fishing is firing during the Jersey summer. Nick sets out with flounder pro Capt. Lou Grazioso to dial the fluke in, then gathers an old school crew of friends and their kids to try their luck on the party boat Gambler, competing to see who can win the battle of the pros vs. the newbies.

programme.title: Saltwater Underground
programme.desc: Nick visits the Crystal Coast of North Carolina to search out redfish and seatrout in the backwaters with Capt. Joe Tunstall and Capt. Chris Kimney.

programme.title: Local Knowledge
programme.desc: When it comes to fishing and the marine industry, we are often more united by the Bluefin tuna than we think. For Ali Hussainy, the Bluefin is responsible for fueling his life long passion as an angler, and in this episode he gets to share that passion with two friends that have their own ties to the species. For wildlife biologist Forrest Galante and master sushi chef Hiroyuki Terada, catching a bluefin tuna on rod and reel will be a first!

programme.title: Local Knowledge
programme.desc: The Local Knowledge crew heads to Catalina Island off the coast of Southern California to participate in the 2024 War Heroes On Water tournament. This event offers a unique opportunity for the sport fishing community to create meaningful connections with our nation's heroes while raising awareness of the challenges they sometimes face when transitioning back to civilian life. With a little bit of luck and a lot of teamwork, Ali and Rush hope to put their veterans on a Bluefin tuna bite they won't forget!

programme.title: Local Knowledge
programme.desc: Rush takes up an invite from good friend and fellow guide Jared Cyr to sight fish for barracuda and bonefish in the shallow waters of the Florida Keys. Meanwhile Rush's boat takes a break from charter fishing to get a new Seakeeper RIDE system installed.

programme.title: Local Knowledge
programme.desc: After a great trip fishing the flats, Rush returns the favor and extends an invite to friend Jarred Cyr fishing offshore. Fishing in Key West is all about the variety of species and opportunities they present. Mixing it up and taking advantage of this, the guys decide to see how many species they can catch using light spin and fly tackle offshore.

programme.title: Local Knowledge
programme.desc: The LK crew returns to Guatemala with more friends for our yearly dose of world class fishing! Year after year, Casa Vieja Lodge continues to impress with daily shots at sailfish, marlin, mahi, and tuna. Tag along on our 2nd annual group trip for a tropical fishing experience like no other!

programme.title: Local Knowledge
programme.desc: Heavy hearts find comfort in cherished memories as the Local Knowledge crew mourns the loss of one of the greatest members of the fishing industry. Looking back on several of our episodes with our dear friend Dave Salazar, we celebrate the life of this amazing fishermen, family man, and visionary behind the world renowned Casa Vieja Lodge.

programme.title: Saltwater Experience
programme.desc: Captains Tom Rowland and Rich Tudor meet up with Captain Nick LaBadie at Big Pine Key for an action packed day on the flats chasing tarpon, bonefish and permit for the elusive grand slam.

programme.title: Winchester Life
programme.desc: Every spring brings a new opportunity to take a step forward & recall the memories of seasons past. World War II Veteran and retired Judge Arden Hill has spent most of his life chasing turkeys in the hills of Tennessee. Now in his 90’s, Arden doesn’t let age stand in the way of his love for spring turkey hunting. Also: patterning turkey shotguns and hunting spring gobblers.

programme.title: Winchester Life
programme.desc: Winchester introduces the Shoot United brand aimed at offering useful information and tips to the millions of new shooters entering the shooting sports. New York native and Midland University competitive shotgun shooter Amy Cawley and her journey as a student-athlete is followed. Also: Theo Ribbs gives shooting tips for competition and Foster Bartholow reviews Winchester AA Diamond Grade.

programme.title: Winchester Life
programme.desc: Charles Rodney’s relationship with his hunting dogs, passion for field-to-table living and connection to the land make his love for chasing rabbits contagious while the heritage of Winchester’s small game ammunition makes this beloved pastime accessible for generations to come. Also: a Model 42 collection for the ages and hunting Kansas coyotes with the Keefer Brothers.

programme.title: Winchester Life
programme.desc: Deer season — the sights, the sounds and the smells stick with you. It’s about remembering those who came before us and setting the right example for those who look up to us. programme.title: Local Knowledge
programme.desc: When it comes to fishing and the marine industry, we are often more united by the Bluefin tuna than we think. For Ali Hussainy, the Bluefin is responsible for fueling his life long passion as an angler, and in this episode he gets to share that passion with two friends that have their own ties to the species. For wildlife biologist Forrest Galante and master sushi chef Hiroyuki Terada, catching a bluefin tuna on rod and reel will be a first!

programme.title: Local Knowledge
programme.desc: The Local Knowledge crew heads to Catalina Island off the coast of Southern California to participate in the 2024 War Heroes On Water tournament. This event offers a unique opportunity for the sport fishing community to create meaningful connections with our nation's heroes while raising awareness of the challenges they sometimes face when transitioning back to civilian life. With a little bit of luck and a lot of teamwork, Ali and Rush hope to put their veterans on a Bluefin tuna bite they won't forget!

programme.title: Local Knowledge

programme.title: Local Knowledge

programme.title: Local Knowledge

programme.title: Local Knowledge

programme.desc: A disgraced ex-cop shocks the city when he threatens to jump off a 21-story building but, while the city is distracted, a diamond heist gets underway.

programme.title: Force of Nature
programme.desc: A disgraced cop, a survivalist doctor and her retired detective dad join forces against a gang of thieves as a category 5 hurricane engulfs the city.

programme.title: Freelancers
programme.desc: Malo, the son of a fallen NYPD officer, joins the force, where he falls in with his father's former partner and a team of rogue cops.

programme.title: Fast Color
programme.desc: Hunted by mysterious forces, a young woman with supernatural abilities flees back to her family.

programme.title: Push
programme.desc: A group of people with psychic powers take on a shady government agency bent on using them as a secret weapons in this action thriller.

programme.title: Mortal
programme.desc: A psychologist finds herself drawn to a mysterious murder suspect who claims to possess godlike powers.

programme.title: Ender's Game
programme.desc: A talented young man is selected to lead humanity’s fight against a dangerous alien race, who have attempted to take over the Earth.

programme.title: Kin
programme.desc: After using a mysterious weapon to protect his family, a young man goes on the run with his older brother, hoping to evade otherworldly soldiers.

programme.title: Project Ithaca
programme.desc: Five strangers wake up aboard an alien spacecraft and realize that their abductors have been harvesting human fear for eons.

programme.title: Fast Color
programme.desc: Hunted by mysterious forces, a young woman with supernatural abilities flees back to her family.

programme.title: Mr. Troop Mom
programme.desc: Looking to reconnect with his daughter, a career-focused dad becomes a fish out of water when he elects to chaperone her scout troop's camping trip.

programme.title: The 11th Hour
programme.desc: Leading scientists, thinkers, and politicians discuss what can be done in the face of climate change and the collapse of life-sustaining ecosystems.

programme.title: The Accidental Tourist
programme.desc: The touching story of a travel writer who hates to travel and loves order - until suddenly everything changes.

programme.title: Caddyshack II
programme.desc: The snobs of Bushwood Country Club don't know who they're messing with.

programme.title: Cannonball Run II
programme.desc: A wealthy man offers a fortune to the first person able to travel from California to Connecticut by car.

programme.title: Hero at Large
programme.desc: Foiling a robbery at a convenience store while wearing his Captain Avenger costume turns a struggling actor into a real-life vigilante crime fighter.

programme.title: The Hudsucker Proxy
programme.desc: When the founder of a large corporation suddenly dies, the board conspires to tank the stock price by installing a lowly mailroom clerk as president.

programme.title: Corruptor, The
programme.desc: A hard-hitting tale of deception, violence and betrayal in New York City's Chinatown.

programme.title: Tenacious D in The Pick of Destiny
programme.desc: Musicians JB and KG set out on a quest for a legendary guitar pick.

programme.title: Imagine: John Lennon
programme.desc: A film documenting John Lennon's profound impact on the world via footage shot during Lennon's life.

programme.title: Jimi Hendrix
programme.desc: In this riveting documentary, Hendrix's family and close friends, joined by rock legends, present their memories of the greatest rock guitarist ever.

programme.title: Almost Heroes
programme.desc: In 1804, a habitually drunk tracker and his foppish blowhard pal lead a crew of misfits on a race to beat Lewis and Clark to the Pacific Ocean.

programme.title: Sesame Street Presents: Follow That Bird
programme.desc: Big Bird runs away and all his old buddies join in the search to find him. Will Big Bird return home?

programme.title: Best Friends
programme.desc: Goldie Hawn and Burt Reynolds star as two screenwriters who face chaos after meeting each other's families.

programme.title: Disorderlies
programme.desc: Three friends must save a wealthy, ailing curmudgeon from the morbid plans of the man's greedy nephew.

programme.title: Monkey Trouble
programme.desc: Eva's (Thora Birch) mom (Mimi Rodgers) is obsessively neat; her dad's (Christopher McDonald) allergic to fur. But when a thieving organ grinder's (Harvey Keitel) monkey escapes, Eva bonds with a new friend. As much as she tries, Eva can't housebreak her new pet ... or break him of his training to steal. And Eva's getting the blame in this heartwarming family comedy.

programme.title: Oh, God!
programme.desc: When God comes to Earth, he struggles to convince his chosen messenger about who he really is.

programme.title: Oh, God! Book II
programme.desc: God returns to Earth and recruits a student to help him devise an advertising campaign to spread his message.

programme.title: Oh, God! You Devil
programme.desc: A musician sells his soul to the Devil, as God and the Devil battle for the musician's soul.

programme.title: Final Descent
programme.desc: When his aircraft collides with another plane in midair, Captain Glen "Lucky" Singer must try to save the lives of his 319 passengers.

programme.title: Final Run
programme.desc: On a family trip, Glen "Lucky" Singer must stop a train from careening toward disaster when an engineer's mistake causes a glitch in the controls.

programme.title: Talhotblond
programme.desc: Thomas meets a beautiful teenager online, with whom he engages in a nearly two-year romance over the Internet until she learns the truth about him, which leads Thomas to exact the ultimate revenge.

programme.title: Masterminds
programme.desc: A tech geek expelled from school for pulling pranks on staff becomes the one person with enough savvy to rescue students from a gang of kidnappers.

programme.title: Brian's Song
programme.desc: Mekhi Phifer and Sean Maher star in the remake of the classic sports drama about two NFL contenders whose friendship is tragically cut short.

programme.title: Cowboy Up
programme.desc: Follow the tumultuous life of two brothers, Ely, a rising rodeo star, and Hank, a rodeo clown, as they make their way through the bull riding circuit.

programme.title: Basic
programme.desc: The disappearance of a Sergeant and three of his cadets on a training mission brings an ex-Army Ranger-turned-DEA-enforcer into the jungles of Panama.

programme.title: The Marine 6: Close Quarters
programme.desc: Jake Carter and another former Marine, Luke Trapper, join forces to rescue a kidnapped girl from a gang of international criminals.

programme.title: Gloria
programme.desc: Released from prison, Gloria finds herself the reluctant guardian of a young boy who has become the target of a ruthless multinational conglomerate.

programme.title: Quicksilver
programme.desc: Losing his shirt after a bad day on the market, a stock trader makes ends meet as a bicycle courier and uncovers sinister web of intrigue and murder.

programme.title: Finding Graceland
programme.desc: A grieving and guilt-ridden recent widower finds himself on a road trip to Memphis after picking up a hitchhiker who claims he’s Elvis Presley.

programme.title: The Broken Hearts Club: A Romantic Comedy
programme.desc: A group of gay friends in Los Angeles share the ups and downs of relationships, careers, fatherhood, the deaths of friends, and new beginnings.

programme.title: Perfect
programme.desc: An intrepid Rolling Stone reporter bumps up against a publicity-shy aerobics instructor while covering a sexy scoop on her Los Angeles health club.

programme.title: Surrender, Dorothy
programme.desc: Hoping to learn more about her daughter Sara after her sudden death, Natalie retreats to the beach house where Sara's friends are summering.

programme.title: To Gillian on Her 37th Birthday
programme.desc: After the death of his loving wife, David is torn by grief, and has been fixating on her spirit. Now he must let go of her in order to move on.

programme.title: My Life
programme.desc: A young ad executive facing terminal cancer and expecting a child records his life's journey, confronting his past for his unborn child's future.

programme.title: Swept From the Sea
programme.desc: Amy, a servant girl, and Yanko, the sole survivor of a capsized ship bound for America, begin a fiery affair at the end of the nineteenth century.

programme.title: Every Time We Say Goodbye
programme.desc: When an American pilot meets a serene Jewish girl of Spanish descent during World War II, their diverse backgrounds might mean love could never work.

programme.title: Seven Years in Tibet
programme.desc: True story of a cocky Austrian mountain climber who escapes an Indian prison camp during WWII and goes to Tibet where he befriends the Dalai Lama.

programme.title: A Woman of Distinction
programme.desc: To garner publicity for the college, a press agent plants a story in the press about a torrid affair between an icy dean and a visiting professor.

programme.title: Berserk
programme.desc: Suspicions fall on the imperious ringmistress of a traveling circus when she appears unfazed by a series of mysterious and grisly murders.

programme.title: The Lone Wolf and His Lady
programme.desc: When a gem disappears from an exhibition, jewel-thief-turned-reporter Lone Wolf (Ron Randell) is accused.

programme.title: A Dandy in Aspic
programme.desc: In this stylish spy thriller, a Londoner working in British Intelligence, Alexander Eberlin, turns out to be a Russian counter-espionage agent.

programme.title: No Sad Songs for Me
programme.desc: Upon being diagnosed with terminal cancer, selfless suburban housewife Mary Scott (Margaret Sullavan) makes the ultimate sacrifice: she decides to keep the unpleasant news from her husband, Brad (Wendell Corey), and daughter, Polly, to avoid devastating her loved ones. Instead, Mary encourages Brad's affair with a co-worker (Viveca Lindfors), and even grooms the other woman to take her place. But as Mary's illness progresses, keeping it a secret presents a considerable challenge.

programme.title: The Wrecking Crew
programme.desc: Superspy, Matt Helm, with the help of agent Freya Carlson, travels to Denmark to find the mastermind behind the heist of a billion in US gold bullion.

programme.title: The Fuller Brush Girl
programme.desc: Fired from her job as a switchboard operator, a daffy young woman tries her hand at door-to-door cosmetics sales only to get mixed up in a murder rap.

programme.title: Walk, Don't Run
programme.desc: During the Olympics, an electronics expert learns his hotel room will not be available for two days, and is forced to share an apartment with a woman.

programme.title: Boots Malone
programme.desc: A down-on-his-luck jockey's agent takes a wealthy, yet neglected kid under his wing, and, with the help of others, turns him into a champion.

programme.title: Shopworn
programme.desc: After her release from a three-month prison sentence, Kitty Lane becomes an overnight musical sensation and renews her romance with David Livingston.

programme.title: The Taming of the Shrew
programme.desc: A rich merchant's beautiful daughter and her volatile older sister are courted by rival suitors in this rambunctious version of Shakespeare's comedy.

programme.title: Let Us Live
programme.desc: When a confused eyewitness identifies New York City cabbie Brick Tennant (Henry Fonda) as a killer, he is sentenced to death for a murder that he wasn't involved in. Though no one is willing to listen to the innocent prisoner's pleas for freedom, Brick's faithful fiancée, Mary (Maureen O'Sullivan), knows that her lover is innocent -- because she was with him when the crime was committed. As the scheduled execution draws ever nearer, Mary begins to investigate the murder herself.

programme.title: The Guilt of Janet Ames
programme.desc: War widow Janet Ames (Rosalind Russell) is struck by a car, and later her doctors suspect she may have been attempting suicide. A note in her pocket lists five men whom her husband died saving in battle, and they are contacted to help Janet's recovery. The first man on the list, jaded reporter Smitty Cobb (Melvyn Douglas), is offended when Janet says she hopes to prove her husband died in vain to save five worthless men, and offers to "introduce" Janet to each of the men through hypnotism.

programme.title: The Whole Truth
programme.desc: Bored with his marriage, a movie producer has an affair with a temperamental actress. When she ends up murdered, all clues point to him as the killer.

programme.title: The Solid Gold Cadillac
programme.desc: A small stockholder-turned-corporate heroine ousts a crooked Board of Trustees and reinstates an honest director, falling in love along the way.

programme.title: Let's Do It Again!
programme.desc: In this 1953 musical remake of The Awful Truth, a recently-divorced couple try every way to make each other jealous.

programme.title: Rusty Leads the Way
programme.desc: With the help of his canine buddy, Rusty, a kind, young kid performs good deeds for people and befriends a blind girl in the process.

programme.title: The Magic Carpet
programme.desc: When his parents, the caliph and queen, are murdered by usurper Ali (Gregory Gaye), the newborn Ramoth is delivered to the safety of his uncle, Ahkmid (William Fawcett), via a magic carpet. The adult Ramoth (John Agar) becomes masked hero the Scarlet Falcon. After tricking the reigning caliph into appointing him the royal physician, Ramoth learns of his noble birth and, with the help of faithful Razi (George Tobias) and beautiful Lida (Patricia Medina), he fights Ali and his wrathful minions.

programme.title: Brief Moment
programme.desc: Based on a play by S.N. Behrman.

programme.title: Hook, Line and Sinker
programme.desc: Diagnosed with a terminal illness, Peter decides to go out with a bang— racking up $100,000 in credit card debt—only to find he's not dying after all.

programme.title: The Undercover Man
programme.desc: Determined Treasury Department investigator Frank Warren (Glenn Ford) goes after a ruthless mobster known as The Big Fellow. When a key informant is murdered, Warren pursues the gangster on charges of tax evasion. But, with a slick mob lawyer hampering him at every turn, and threats being lobbed toward Warren's wife (Nina Foch), the lawman's chances of achieving a conviction are slim to none. His only hope is that one syndicate bookkeeper will have the courage to turn state's evidence.

programme.title: The Desperados
programme.desc: A family of Confederate guerrillas continues to kill long after the Civil War has ended. One of the sons breaks with the family to make a new life.

programme.title: J.W. Coop
programme.desc: After spending a decade behind bars for writing bad checks and punching a cop, former rodeo star J.W. Coop (Cliff Robertson) re-enters a world drastically different from how he left it; the only constant seems to be his mother (Geraldine Page). Gradually coming to terms with societal changes and cultural norms, Coop is determined to climb back to the top spot on the rodeo circuit. Along the way, he hooks up with Bean (Cristina Ferrare), a liberated woman who helps him catch up to modern life.

programme.title: Gunfighters
programme.desc: Brazos Kane, a gunslinger who's vowed to kill no more, goes to work for a land baron on a ranch, where he is unjustly accused of murder.

programme.title: A Time for Killing
programme.desc: After Capt. Dorrit Bentley (George Hamilton) and his fellow Confederate troops escape from a Union prison, Maj. Wolcott (Glenn Ford) sets out to recapture the fugitives. As protection, the Southern escapees abduct Wolcott's lovely fiancée, Emily Biddle (Inger Stevens), and head toward Mexico. On their way to the border, they kill a Northern messenger bearing word that the Civil War is over and keep this information to themselves, resulting in more conflict with Union soldiers.

programme.title: Buck and the Preacher
programme.desc: A trail guide who protects former slaves and a con-man join forces against bounty hunters hired to drive the former slaves back into the south.

programme.title: Desert Vigilante
programme.desc: The Durango Kid (Charles Starrett) bags Mexican-border silver smugglers for Uncle Sam.

programme.title: The Gun That Won the West
programme.desc: Superior Springfield rifles help scouts (Dennis Morgan, Richard Denning) and the cavalry get forts built in Wyoming.

programme.title: The Guns of Fort Petticoat
programme.desc: Texan and U.S. Cavalryman Lt. Frank Hewitt (Audie Murphy) deserts the army after Colorado Union soldiers carry out the deadly Sand Creek reservation massacre, fearing reprisal from the Cheyenne. Crossing into Texas, Franks finds himself labeled a traitor for fighting with the Yankees, and his warnings about possible Indian revenge go unheeded. When a town near a mission, populated mostly by women, is attacked, Frank is appointed their protector and must build an army comprised of townswomen.

programme.title: Massacre Canyon
programme.desc: A cavalry officer and two of his men set out to make sure that a shipment of guns safely reaches its destination.

programme.title: Alvarez Kelly
programme.desc: Alvarez Kelly (William Holden) is a Mexican cattle rancher who is doing his best to stay out of the Civil War. He has no interest in which side may win or lose -- Kelly is far more concerned about his own survival, and about making money. He soon finds himself in the middle of the conflict, however, when a confederate colonel (Richard Widmark) captures the rancher and forces Kelly to help his soldiers steal a nearby herd of cattle, which they desperately need for food.

programme.title: Blackjack Ketchum, Desperado
programme.desc: A gunfighter (Howard Duff) wants peace in the valley, but a cattle baron (Victor Jory) and his brothers want war.

programme.title: The Wild Westerners
programme.desc: A U.S. marshal (James Philbrook) and his wife (Nancy Kovack) bring Union gold east through outlaws and Indians.

programme.title: They Came to Cordura
programme.desc: On a mission to Mexico, U.S. Maj. Tom Thorn (Gary Cooper) is branded a coward, while several of his fellow servicemen are praised for showing bravery. Tom is asked to transport the heroes through harsh terrain so they can be honored. Also along for the journey is Adelaide Geary (Rita Hayworth), a woman charged with conspiring against the United States. But, as his fellow soldiers begin revealing their treacherous sides, Tom realizes that Adelaide is the only heroic one of the bunch.

programme.title: The Texican
programme.desc: Deputy Jess Carlin (Audie Murphy) leaves his Texas hometown in disgrace, framed by corrupt saloon owner Luke Starr (Broderick Crawford) for a crime he didn't commit. When his brother, muckraking newspaper editor Roy Carlin (Víctor Vilanova), is murdered after printing an exposé of Starr's crooked deals, Carlin returns home from the Mexican border town where he's been holed up and enlists his brother's fiancée (Luz Márquez) and saloon dancer Kit O'Neal (Diana Lorys) to bring Starr down.

programme.title: Ride Beyond Vengeance
programme.desc: Based on the novel by Al Dewlen.

programme.title: The Last Frontier
programme.desc: Jed Cooper (Victor Mature), a trapper, enlists as an army fort scout, and shortly after meets and falls for Corinna Marston (Anne Bancroft), the wife of a nearby fort's commander. Jed comes across her husband, Col. Marston (Robert Preston), after he's suffered an attack at the hands of Native Americans. Col. Marston forces the captain of Jed's fort, Glenn Riordan (Guy Madison), to send out Jed and the troops to fight his attackers, despite their lack of battle experience.

programme.title: Relentless
programme.desc: Framed for a murder he didn't commit, a cowboy hides with a traveling woman as he flees a sheriff and hunts for the real killer.

programme.title: Buchanan Rides Alone
programme.desc: Journeying from Mexico back home to West Texas, mercenary Tom Buchanan (Randolph Scott) takes a break for the night in the border town of Agry. He soon discovers that almost every resident -- from the crooked sheriff (Barry Kelley) to the shifty-eyed innkeeper -- is a member of the prominent Agry family. When Buchanan defends Juan de la Vega (Manuel Rojas), a young man about to be lynched for shooting the town drunk, he himself is accused of murder and must struggle to escape town alive.

programme.title: Jesse James vs. the Daltons
programme.desc: An outcast rumored to be the son of notorious outlaw Jesse James makes contact with the Dalton gang in hopes of learning the truth about his lineage.

programme.title: The Kid From Broken Gun
programme.desc: After years on the East Coast, former boxer Jack Mahoney (Jack Mahoney) returns to New Mexico and finds himself framed for murder. Though the only evidence is circumstantial, in the face of vicious prosecutor Kiefer (Myron Healey), Mahoney's girlfriend -- defense lawyer Gail Kingston (Angela Stevens) -- fails to convince the jury of his innocence. Determined to clear Mahoney's name, postal worker Steve Reynolds (Charles Starrett) transforms himself into the masked rider known as the Durango Kid.

programme.title: Striking Rescue
programme.desc: They killed his wife. They killed his daughter. Now, Muay Thai expert Bai An (Tony Jaa) is coming for them.

programme.title: Fearless Kung Fu King
programme.desc: In order to establish himself in Jinmen as one of the best fighters around, Huo Yuanjia challenges seven Kung Fu schools from around the world.

programme.title: Code Of The Assassins
programme.desc: On his first mission, a young assassin is ensnared in a plot that forces him to go on the run from the government and rival assassin groups.

programme.title: Furie
programme.desc: When a little girl is kidnapped by a trafficking ring, her mother, a notorious former gang leader, will go to any lengths to bring her daughter home.

programme.title: Striking Rescue
programme.desc: They killed his wife. They killed his daughter. Now, Muay Thai expert Bai An (Tony Jaa) is coming for them.

programme.title: Shadow
programme.desc: The multiple-award-winning action film about a kingdom commander facing betrayal at all angles who has a lookalike shadow who can slay his foes.

programme.title: Unstoppable
programme.desc: A hardworking husband’s life is turned upside down when he returns home one day to find his house in disarray and his wife missing.

programme.title: Bitcoin Heist
programme.desc: To catch the world's most wanted, an agent assembles a team of hackers to plan the ultimate heist.

programme.title: Assassins of Brotherhood
programme.desc: A secret military organization must ward of a rebellion orchestrated by the Ministry of War.

programme.title: Call of Heroes
programme.desc: When a village finds itself in the war path of a powerful general’s psychopathic son and his army, a group of fighters set out to avenge their deaths.

programme.title: Shadow
programme.desc: The multiple-award-winning action film about a kingdom commander facing betrayal at all angles who has a lookalike shadow who can slay his foes.

programme.title: Unstoppable
programme.desc: A hardworking husband’s life is turned upside down when he returns home one day to find his house in disarray and his wife missing.

programme.title: Assassins of Brotherhood

programme.title: Call of Heroes
programme.desc: When a village finds itself in the war path of a powerful general’s psychopathic son and his army, a group of fighters set out to avenge their deaths.

programme.title: Night Of The Assassin
programme.desc: After witnessing a brutal campaign of terror against local villagers, Joseon’s deadliest assassin comes out of retirement to exact revenge.

programme.title: Triple Threat
programme.desc: World's top action stars unite in a high-stakes thriller: mercenaries vs. assassins to save a billionaire's daughter.

programme.title: Eye for an Eye: The Blind Swordsman
programme.desc: After a power struggle results in an innocent citizen’s assassination, a highly trained and deadly swordsman seeks justice—and revenge.

programme.title: The Crimson Pirate
programme.desc: A pirate gets mixed up in a Caribbean revolution.

programme.desc: Because someone’s gotta do it, a Texas cattleman takes on the task of cleaning up the wild and lawless Dodge City while courting one of its women.

programme.title: They Won't Believe Me
programme.desc: A faithless husband is charged with a murder he didn't commit.

programme.title: The Tender Trap
programme.desc: A swinging bachelor finds love when he meets a girl immune to his line.

programme.title: Seven Brides for Seven Brothers
programme.desc: A bride attempts to turn her six brothers-in-law into gentlemen.

programme.desc: Two aging sisters are connected by mutual dependency, jealousy and hatred.

programme.title: What's Up, Doc?
programme.desc: When suitcases are mixed up, a chase across San Francisco follows.

programme.title: Viva Las Vegas!
programme.desc: As he prepares for the Las Vegas Grand Prix, Lucky tries to secure funds for a new engine while winning the affections of a hotel swim instructor.

programme.title: Sergeant York
programme.desc: Recruited to fight in World War I, a Tennessee farmer with deep pacifist beliefs is driven to take up arms when his unit is overwhelmed by Germans.

programme.title: Papillon
programme.desc: A biography of a man who is unjustly convicted of murder, gets locked up in French Guiana, and devotes his life to escaping from prison.

programme.title: David Copperfield (1935)
programme.desc: Charles Dickens' classic tale of an orphaned boy's fight for happiness.

programme.title: Easy to Love
programme.desc: Williams wins her boss over when she starts an affair with another man.

programme.title: The Goodbye Girl
programme.desc: After her ex leaves and subleases their apartment without warning, an ex-dancer forms an unlikely home with the new tenant, a quirky struggling actor.

programme.title: The Great Race
programme.desc: Set in 1908, dastardly, black-garbed Professor Fate dares the world's greatest hero, The Great Leslie, to race 22,000 miles from New York to Paris.

programme.title: The Americanization of Emily
programme.desc: A black comedy about honor, cowardice and unexpected heroism.

programme.title: Jeremiah Johnson
programme.desc: An 1830s loner leaves civilization and learns how to be a mountain man.

programme.title: NCIS: New Orleans
programme.desc: Pride needs to protect a family friend engaged to the prime suspect in an ongoing NCIS and FBI cartel case.

programme.title: NCIS: New Orleans
programme.desc: Sebastian goes under cover; Patton practices his old gambling skills; Pride and the team embark on a perilous plan to trap Garcia.

programme.title: NCIS: New Orleans
programme.desc: After Pride travels to a deep-sea oil rig for a murder investigation, the team uncovers a gas leak that's on the verge of causing a catastrophic explosion; Sebastian starts his NCIS special agent training.

programme.title: NCIS: New Orleans
programme.desc: After thousands of classified government files are stolen, the NCIS team searches for an underground group of hackers who were co-founded by Elvis Bertrand, Pride's old contact.

programme.title: NCIS: New Orleans
programme.desc: NCIS agents McGee and Torres head to New Orleans to partner with Pride and his team in the search for the missing homeland security theoretical terror playbook.

programme.title: NCIS: New Orleans
programme.desc: Painful memories come flooding back when a gruesome copycat murder leads to the reopening of a case for Wade.

programme.title: NCIS: New Orleans
programme.desc: Pride's longtime friend, state and military attorney Rita Devereaux, asks NCIS to investigate the disappearance of a JAG lawyer who specializes in classified cases and volunteers at a private military academy.

programme.title: NCIS: New Orleans
programme.desc: A highly skilled special operations Marine assaults six men in a bar, sending the NCIS team on a city-wide manhunt.

programme.title: NCIS: New Orleans
programme.desc: Tammy is reunited with her ex-husband, Ethan McKinley - who embezzled millions in Katrina relief funds - after he's tied to the murder of a crime boss' son.

programme.title: NCIS: New Orleans
programme.desc: A deadly accident at a naval base exposes a unit of Seabees to a super virus and leaves the rest of the base and the city of New Orleans at risk for an outbreak; Wade is infected with the virus and given hours to live.

programme.title: NCIS: New Orleans
programme.desc: Lasalle must investigate his former partner in the Vice unit after the NCIS team finds a link between an international drug ring and the New Orleans Police Department; Rita looks into a connection between the mayor and illegal activity in Clearwater.

programme.title: NCIS: New Orleans
programme.desc: Pride listens in on a wiretap of Mayor Hamilton; the NCIS team investigates when Navy weapons get stolen in a train heist; featuring musical performances by Sheryl Crow.

programme.title: NCIS: New Orleans
programme.desc: The murder of a Navy chaplain leads Pride to uncover a possible connection between Mayor Hamilton and illegal activity taking place in the city of Clearwater; Percy continues to face repercussions of her choices on a previous case.

programme.title: NCIS: New Orleans
programme.desc: When Pride is spotted tracking one of Mayor Hamilton's accomplices on a crowded street, the suspect opens fire, putting innocent lives at risk before disappearing.

programme.title: NCIS: New Orleans
programme.desc: Unable to trust anyone in New Orleans, the NCIS team calls in FBI Assistant Director Isler to help expose and stop Mayor Hamilton's sinister scheme.

programme.title: NCIS: New Orleans
programme.desc: While Pride remains on probation after his rogue takedown of the corrupt Mayor Hamilton, his team is closely monitored by a strict supervisor; the team must secretly investigate after the FBI takes the lead on a case involving stolen nuclear waste.

programme.title: NCIS: New Orleans
programme.desc: An erratic whistleblower who calls Pride her mentor kidnaps him to help her locate a serial killer targeting young women in the Gulf of Mexico.

programme.title: NCIS: New Orleans
programme.desc: The team joins forces with FBI Director Isler after a Russian operative with intelligence on sleeper agents disappears; Tammy partners with former sleeper agent Eva Azarova to assist in the disappearance.

programme.title: Midsomer Murders
programme.desc: A disused airfield near Morton Fendle is the location for a romantic evening between young Simon Bright and his girlfriend Laura Sharp - absolutely nothing could ruin their date. The next morning, when Frances Kirby is out for her morning jog, she notices the vintage car they were in up at the airfield, containing Simon Bright's dead body, with Laura nowhere to be seen. Confused, Detective Chief Inspector Barnaby and D.S. Jones can't work out whether it was a suicide pact or murder. Furthermore, they've got to find Miss Sharp and their investigation leads them to linking Simon and Laura with the villagers of Morton Fendle, who met at Elaine Trim's dancing classes. Eventually, the Barnaby family plus Jones make it to a 40s style dance night at the village hall before more villagers start turning up dead.

programme.title: Midsomer Murders
programme.desc: When Faith Alexander arrives in Midsomer County to meet her long-lost uncle Rex Masters, she gets a shock - Rex's staff had been told that she was dead. Things become even more complex when Rex's body is found in a nearby river, bearing wounds that suggest he was murdered. Barnaby and Jones are soon on the case, trying to establish who would have wanted the elderly man dead. Several people soon come forward with multiple wills, which confuse the matter, but when two more people, close friends of Rex, are also murdered, the investigation raises question on the motive, leading Barnaby to wonder if it was down to finances, passion, or something from Rex's past.

programme.title: CSI: Miami
programme.desc: After returning from war, Horatio's son seeks his help to solve a murder.

programme.title: CSI: Miami

programme.title: CSI: Miami
programme.desc: The team investigates its own department when Horatio's ex-girlfriend is killed in an explosion.
